text.paragraph: The operator can be used to encrypt a document with a password-based algorithm.

inputPorts.port: The document object which should be encrypted.

outputPorts.port: The encrypted input document is outputted here.

parameters.parameter: The password that should be used for document encryption.

This parameter allows to select the strength of the algorithm used to encrypt the document.
This option selects the algorithm 'SHA1' to digest the password and 'RC2' to encrypt the document with the digested password.
This option selects the algorithm 'MD5' to digest the password and '256BITAES-CBC-OPENSSL' to encrypt the document with the digested password. The 256 bit AES encryption is a very secure algorithm but its secureness strongly depends on the password strength. Therefore it is recommended to use a password with at least 20 characters.
This option selects the algorithm 'SHA256' to digest the password and '256BITAES-CBC-BC' to encrypt the document with the digested password. The 256 bit AES encryption is a very secure algorithm but its secureness strongly depends on the password strength. Therefore it is recommended to use a password with at least 20 characters. CAUTION: This option will not work if the JCE unlimited strength jurisdiction policy documents have not been installed for the Java VM running RapidMiner.
This option allows you to directly select the algorithm that should be used to encrypt the document. Only algorithms working on the current setup are being shown. In case the JCE unlimited strength jurisdiction policy documents have been installed, more algorithms will show up which might not work on other machines without the JCE policy documents installed.
